children.name: Avatar

src.description: The source of the avatar image.

alt.description: The alt text for the avatar image.

fallbackUrl.description: The fallback url for the avatar image.

type.description: Can be `'default'` (default, plain avatar), `'status'` (online/offline indicator) or `'social'` (has social network icon from the `network` prop).

network.description: Name of social network icon to overlay. (E.g., `'instagram'`). Only applicable when `{ type: 'social' }`

children.code:
/* eslint-disable */
import React from 'react'

import PropTypes from 'prop-types'
import styled from 'styled-components'
import * as Styles from './style'
import {
  facebook,
  googlebusiness,
  instagram,
  linkedin,
  pinterest,
  shopify,
  tiktok,
  twitter,
  startpage,
  mastodon,
  youtube,
} from '../style/colors'
import {
  Facebook,
  Gbp,
  Instagram,
  LinkedIn,
  Pinterest,
  Shopify,
  Tiktok,
  Twitter,
  StartPage,
  Mastodon,
  Youtube,
} from '../Icon'

const Wrapper = styled.div`
  ${(props) =>
        Styles.wrapper[props.size]}
`

const Image = styled.div`
  ${(props) =>
        Styles.image[props.type][props.size]}
`

const socialIconMap = new Map([
  [
    'instagram',
        ({ size }) => (
      <Styles.SocialIconWrapper size={size} bgColor={instagram}>
        <Instagram size="small" color="white" />
      </Styles.SocialIconWrapper>
    ),
  ],
  [
    'facebook',
        ({ size }) => (
      <Styles.SocialIconWrapper size={size} bgColor={facebook}>
        <Facebook size="small" color="white" />
      </Styles.SocialIconWrapper>
    ),
  ],
  [
    'twitter',
        ({ size }) => (
      <Styles.SocialIconWrapper size={size} bgColor={twitter}>
        <Twitter size="small" color="white" />
      </Styles.SocialIconWrapper>
    ),
  ],
  [
    'linkedin',
        ({ size }) => (
      <Styles.SocialIconWrapper size={size} bgColor={linkedin}>
        <LinkedIn size="small" color="white" />
      </Styles.SocialIconWrapper>
    ),
  ],
  [
    'pinterest',
        ({ size }) => (
      <Styles.SocialIconWrapper size={size} bgColor={pinterest}>
        <Pinterest size="small" color="white" />
      </Styles.SocialIconWrapper>
    ),
  ],
  [
    'googlebusiness',
        ({ size }) => (
      <Styles.SocialIconWrapper size={size} bgColor={googlebusiness}>
        <Gbp size="small" color="white" />
      </Styles.SocialIconWrapper>
    ),
  ],
  [
    'shopify',
        ({ size }) => (
      <Styles.SocialIconWrapper size={size} bgColor={shopify}>
        <Shopify size="small" color="white" />
      </Styles.SocialIconWrapper>
    ),
  ],
  [
    'tiktok',
        ({ size }) => (
      <Styles.SocialIconWrapper size={size} bgColor={tiktok}>
        <Tiktok size="small" color="white" />
      </Styles.SocialIconWrapper>
    ),
  ],
  [
    'startPage',
        ({ size }) => (
      <Styles.SocialIconWrapper size={size} bgColor={startpage}>
        <Styles.StartPageIcon>
          <StartPage size="small" color="white" />{' '}
        </Styles.StartPageIcon>
      </Styles.SocialIconWrapper>
    ),
  ],
  [
    'mastodon',
        ({ size }) => (
      <Styles.SocialIconWrapper size={size} bgColor={mastodon}>
        <Mastodon size="small" color="white" />
      </Styles.SocialIconWrapper>
    ),
  ],
  [
    'youtube',
        ({ size }) => (
      <Styles.SocialIconWrapper size={size} bgColor={youtube}>
        <Youtube size="small" color="white" />
      </Styles.SocialIconWrapper>
    ),
  ],
])

const Avatar = ({ src, alt, type, size, network, fallbackUrl }) => {
  const SocialIcon = network && socialIconMap.get(network)
  return (
        <Wrapper size={size}>
      {SocialIcon && <SocialIcon size={size} />}
      <Image
                size={size}
        type={type}
        src={src}
        fallbackUrl={fallbackUrl}
        alt={alt}
      />
    </Wrapper>
  )
}

Avatar.propTypes = {
  /** The source of the avatar image. */
  src: PropTypes.string.isRequired,
  /** The alt text for the avatar image. */
  alt: PropTypes.string.isRequired,
  /** The fallback url for the avatar image. */
  fallbackUrl: PropTypes.string,
  /** Can be `'default'` (default, plain avatar), `'status'` (online/offline indicator) or `'social'` (has social network icon from the `network` prop). */
  type: PropTypes.oneOf(['default', 'social', 'status']),
  /** Can be `'small'`, `'medium'` or `'large'` (`32px`, `40px` and `48px` respectively). */
  size: PropTypes.oneOf(['large', 'medium', 'small']),
  /** Name of social network icon to overlay. (E.g., `'instagram'`). Only applicable when `{ type: 'social' }` */
  network: PropTypes.oneOf([
    'facebook',
    'twitter',
    'instagram',
    'linkedin',
    'google',
    'pinterest',
    'shopify',
    'tiktok',
    'startPage',
    'googlebusiness',
    'mastodon',
    'youtube',
  ]),
}

Avatar.defaultProps = {
  type: 'default',
  size: 'small',
  fallbackUrl: '',
  network: null,
}

export default Avatar

children.name: Button
children.description:
All buttons, including text and split-buttons, follow the same core principles in dimensions, padding, and font sizes.
Combined with simple modifiers, they can be changed in size and appearance.

isSelect.description: Is this the Select button with chevron

hasIconOnly.description: Does the button have only an icon and no label

icon.description: Icon to show with the label

iconEnd.description: Icon to show with the label

items.description: Items to display in the Split Button popup

children.description: Child element(s) to use for custom Split Button child content

onSelectClick.description: Function to call on Split Button selected item click

fullWidth.description: Is the button the full width of the parent container

tooltip.description: Tooltip to show on the component

ref.description: The prop to get the DOM element of the Button

className.description: class passed by the dom element

onOpen.description: onOpen function to fire when the Dropdown menu is open

hasError.description: It colors the field in red.

help.description: It adds an help text below the input box.

placeholder.description: It's the placeholder value of the input.

prefix.description: Optional object describing fixed text that is placed inside the input, format is `{ text: '@', paddingLeft: '30px' }`

size.description: This is the vertical size of the input field, can be `small`, `regular`, or `tall`

forwardedRef.description:

children.name: Loader
children.code:
import React from 'react'
import { LoaderStyled, Top, Middle, Bottom } from './style'

const Loader = () => (
  <LoaderStyled>
    <svg
      width="36"
      height="40"
      viewBox="0 0 36 40"
      fill="none"
      xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
      role="img"
    >
      <title>Loading</title>
      <Top
        d="M17.914 0.695986L35.258 9.66199L17.89 18.579L0.707985 9.64801L17.914 0.695986Z"
        fill="#3D3D3D"
      />
      <Middle
        d="M0.723011 20.194L6.135 17.512L17.895 23.345L29.782 17.505L35.336 20.205L17.894 28.671L0.723011 20.194Z"
        fill="#3D3D3D"
      />
      <Bottom
        d="M0.68401 30.536L6.12902 27.58L17.896 34.015L29.783 27.626L35.283 30.537L17.897 39.842L0.68401 30.536Z"
        fill="#3D3D3D"
      />
    </svg>
  </LoaderStyled>
)

export default Loader

children.name: Modal

background.description: The style attribute to apply a background to the modal

action.description: The main action settings {**label**: the label of the button,  **disabled** to disable the button, **callback** a callback to invoke on action click, before dismiss, **type** to set the action button type (danger, primary)}

dismissible.description: Verifies if the modal should be dismissed right after the action is executed, in case we are doing a validation inside the modal before closing it

secondaryAction.description: The secondary action settings {**label**: the label of the button, **disabled** to disable the button, **callback** a callback to invoke on action click, before dismiss

cookie.description: The cookie settings if it's omitted the modal won't use cookies {**days**: expire time of the cookie in days, **store**, usually document.cookie, **key**: the key of the cookie}

previousFocus.description: this element will regain focus on modal close

width.description: set a custom modal width, accepts 'wide' as a preset for 730px

noBackground.description: remove the background so only the content shows

closeButton.description: adds a close icon, the function to close remains in your app

children.name: Segmented Control
children.description:
Segmented control used for quickly selecting between a small set of mutually exclusive options.
They work like a group of radio inputs in that no more than one may be selected at a time.
Segmented controls are useful for scenarios where there are only a few options.
If you need to present many options, consider using another component such as a Select.

children.name: Select
children.description: Select component that opens a popup menu on click and displays items that can be selected

onSelectClick.description: Function to call on selected item click

label.description: Label to display on the Select button

hideOnSearch.name: bool
hideOnSearch.description: If true, item will be hidden while searching

items.description: Items to display in the popup

isSplit.description: Is the Select component part of the Split Button

xPosition.description: Position of the popup right or left

yPosition.description: Position of the popup top or bottom

icon.description: Icon to show in the Button

hideSearch.description: Does the Select have a search bar

keyMap.description: Custom keys to used in the Items array

multiSelect.description: Can the select have multiple items selected

shortcutsEnabled.description: If false don't enable keyboard navigation

tooltip.description: Tooltip to show on the component

onClose.description: Callback to be called when the Select menu gets closed

hasIconOnly.description: Does the button have only an icon and no label

marginTop.description: Space between the dropdown and the button

hasCustomAction.description: Indicated whether the select has a custom action

customItemLabel.description: A custom label for a custom item

hotKeys.description: An array of objects containing HotKeys

isInputSearch.description: Boolean to check if the select is triggered by an input instead of a button

selectPopupVisible.description: Indicates if the select popup should be visible

noResultsCustomMessage.description: Custom message to display when no results were found

clearSearchOnBlur.description: Should clear the search field's value when the main input is blurred

textToLeft.description: Aligns text in Select to the left

onOpen.description: onOpen function to fire when the Select menu is open

children.name: States

examples.name: StatesLarge
examples.code:
import React from 'react'
import States from '@bufferapp/ui/States'
import Button from '@bufferapp/ui/Button'
import styled from 'styled-components'

const Wrapper = styled.div`
  height: 562px;
  width: 780px;
  border: 1px solid black;
`

/** States Large (default) Example */
export default function ExampleStates() {
  return (
    <Wrapper>
      <States>
        <States.Image
          src="./images/illustration2.png"
          alt="a colourful illustration of a buffer character"
        />
        <States.Header>We are trying to tell you something</States.Header>
        <States.Description>
          We have something very important to tell you that you should know
          about and we would like to kindly tell you what that is.
        </States.Description>
        <States.Buttons>
          <Button type="primary" onClick={() => {}} label="Click Me" />
        </States.Buttons>
      </States>
    </Wrapper>
  )
}

examples.name: StatesLargeWithMedia
examples.code:
import React from 'react'
import States from '@bufferapp/ui/States'
import Button from '@bufferapp/ui/Button'
import styled from 'styled-components'

const Wrapper = styled.div`
  height: 562px;
  width: 780px;
  border: 1px solid black;
`

/** States Large with Media Example */
export default function ExampleStates() {
  return (
    <Wrapper>
      <States>
        <States.Media>
          <iframe
            title="buffer promo vid"
            width="420"
            height="280"
            src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KHWHAeWQ1u8"
            frameBorder="0"
            allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture"
            allowFullScreen
          />
        </States.Media>
        <States.Header>We are trying to tell you something</States.Header>
        <States.Description>
          We have something very important to tell you that you should know
          about and we would like to kindly tell you what that is.
        </States.Description>
        <States.Buttons>
          <Button type="primary" onClick={() => {}} label="Click Me" />
        </States.Buttons>
      </States>
    </Wrapper>
  )
}

}

examples.code:
import React from 'react'
import States from '@bufferapp/ui/States'
import Button from '@bufferapp/ui/Button'
import styled from 'styled-components'

const Wrapper = styled.div`
  height: 426px;
  width: 480px;
  border: 1px solid black;
  background-color: white;
`

/** States Small with Media Example */
export default function ExampleStates() {
  return (
    <Wrapper>
      <States size="small">
        <States.Media>
          <iframe
            title="buffer promo vid"
            width="300"
            height="200"
            src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KHWHAeWQ1u8"
            frameBorder="0"
            allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture"
            allowFullScreen
          />
        </States.Media>
        <States.Header>We are trying to tell you something</States.Header>
        <States.Description>
          We have something very important to tell you that you should know
          about and we would like to kindly tell you what that is.
        </States.Description>
        <States.Buttons>
          <Button type="primary" onClick={() => {}} label="Click Me" />
        </States.Buttons>
      </States>
    </Wrapper>
  )
}

examples.name: StatesSmallWithTwoButtons
examples.description: States Small With Two Buttons Example
examples.code:
import React from 'react'
import States from '@bufferapp/ui/States'
import Button from '@bufferapp/ui/Button'
import styled from 'styled-components'

const Wrapper = styled.div`
  height: 426px;
  width: 480px;
  border: 1px solid black;
`

/** States Small With Two Buttons Example */
export default function ExampleStates() {
  return (
    <Wrapper>
      <States size="small">
        <States.Image
          src="./images/illustration2.png"
          alt="a colourful illustration of a buffer character"
        />
        <States.Header>We are trying to tell you something</States.Header>
        <States.Description>
          We have something very important to tell you that you should know
          about and we would like to kindly tell you what that is.
        </States.Description>
        <States.Buttons>
          <Button type="secondary" onClick={() => {}} label="Maybe later" />
          <Button type="primary" onClick={() => {}} label="Click Me" />
        </States.Buttons>
      </States>
    </Wrapper>
  )
}

children.name: Switch

label.description: It adds a label to the left of the switch.

isOn.description: The value for whether the switch is on or off

id.description: The id for the label and input

disabled.description: It removes pointer and changes it to readonly

handleSwitch.description: It changes the checked value of the switch

examples.name: SwitchDisabled
SwitchOff
SwitchOn

children.name: Tag

children.description: The actual content of the tag.

textColor.description: The color of the text. It can be: `white`, `gray`, `grayDark`, `blue` and `red`.

examples.name: CountTag
IconTag
TextTag

children.name: Text

hasError.description:
It changes the color of the text to red.
This is only used for `help`.

htmlFor.description:
It's the name of the input it refers to.
This is only used for `label`.

color.description:
The color can be: `white`, `gray`, `grayDark`, `blue` and `red`.
Not used for `span` and `help`.

type.description:
The type can be: `h1`, `h2`, `h3`, `p`, `label`, `help`.
If omitted will return a `span`

as.description: If you want to keep all the styling you've applied to a component but just switch out what's being ultimately rendered (be it a different HTML tag or a different custom component), you can use the "as" prop to do this at runtime.

examples.name: withHotkey
examples.code:
import React from 'react'
import Tooltip from '@bufferapp/ui/Tooltip'
import Avatar from '@bufferapp/ui/Avatar' // eslint-disable-line

/** With Hotkey */
export default function ExampleTooltip() {
  return (
    <Tooltip
      label="My Tooltip Label with multiple lines. Adding up an example here with a long tooltip text."
      position="bottom"
      hotkey="+C"
    >
      <Avatar
        src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/buffer-ui/Default+Avatar.png"
        alt="@joelgascoigne"
        size="medium"
      />
    </Tooltip>
  )
}
